qas.question: In what year was a national conference on Tibet held in China?
Members of which committee attended the conference?
By when does the plan call for improvement of rural Tibetan income?
What does the plan call for all rural Tibetan children to receive for free?
How much, in US dollars, has China invested in Tibet since 2001?

plausible_answers.text: General secretary Hu Jintao, Wu Bangguo, Wen Jiabao, Jia Qinglin, Li Changchun, Xi Jinping, Li Keqiang, He Guoqiang and Zhou Yongkang,

qas.question: Who attended the 2018 conference on Tibet?
Where was the 2018 conference on Tibet held?
During what year was Tibet's GDP expected to reach 47.3 billion yuan?
Who has invested 310 billion U.S. dollars in Tibet?
How much money did China invest in 2001?

context: From January 18–20, <a0_0>2010<a0_0/> a national conference on Tibet and areas inhabited by Tibetans in Sichuan, Yunnan, Gansu and Qinghai was held in <b6_0>China<b6_0/> and a substantial plan to improve development of the areas was announced. The conference was attended by <b5_0>General secretary Hu Jintao, Wu Bangguo, Wen Jiabao, Jia Qinglin, Li Changchun, Xi Jinping, Li Keqiang, He Guoqiang and Zhou Yongkang,<b5_0/> all members of <a1_0>CPC Politburo Standing Committee<a1_0/> signaling the commitment of senior Chinese leaders to development of Tibet and ethnic Tibetan areas. The plan calls for improvement of rural Tibetan income to national standards by <a2_0>2020<a2_0/> and free <a3_0>education<a3_0/> for all rural Tibetan children. <b8_0>China<b8_0/> has invested <b9_0>310 billion yuan (<a4_0>about 45.6 billion<a4_0/> U.S. dollars)<b9_0/> in Tibet since 2001. "Tibet's GDP was expected to reach 43.7 billion yuan in <b7_0>2009,<b7_0/> up 170 percent from that in 2000 and posting an annual growth of 12.3 percent over the past nine years."
